meanings.definition: Adjusted or standardized according to a norm or standard.
meanings.sent1: The normed test scores helped compare students' performance.
meanings.sent2: The normed values made it easier to understand the data.
meanings.sent3: The normed cupcakes were all the same size, making them look like a perfect set.
meanings.sent4: Her normed approach to problem-solving ensured consistency in results.
meanings.sent5: The normed ruler ensured accurate measurements every time.

meanings.definition: To establish or apply a norm or standard to something.
meanings.sent1: The teacher normed the grading system for fairness.
meanings.sent2: She normed the process to ensure consistency.
meanings.sent3: He normed the dance moves, making everyone laugh at the synchronized chaos.
meanings.sent4: The coach normed the team's performance to reach new heights.
meanings.sent5: Norming the rules helped maintain order in the classroom.
